title: Elton John's autobiography is a moving testament to the redemptive power of sport
text:
A fascinating sporting memoir was published this week, with considerable fanfare. And yet, when I popped into my local bookshop, I discovered that Sir Elton John’s Me had been misfiled in the music section.

Admittedly, there is also a fair amount of rock and roll in these 376 pages. But you do find yourself wondering whether the piano is the author’s first true love – or whether that honour might actually go to Watford FC. “I’m not exaggerating,” he writes, “when I say I think Watford might have saved my life.”

Me raises many intriguing questions – including whether Elton might be Britain’s sportiest pop star. It is an appealingly subversive thought, undermining those age-old assumptions that...
description: A fascinating sporting memoir was published this week, with considerable fanfare.
